author: bridge-bot
content:
<KamilChNethermind> Added new interesting panel if you want to see aggregated view of all scenarios where "BenchmarkClient" is slower and who is the fastest
https://grafana.observability.ethpandaops.io/d/feo4ronhsqv40h/opcodes-benchmarking-github-action?orgId=1&from=2025-08-07T17:28:23.605Z&to=2025-08-07T18:37:37.451Z&timezone=browser&var-posgreSQL=benuragv7iuwwb&var-ClientName=$__all&var-TestTitle=$__all&refresh=auto&var-query0=&var-BenchmarkClient=nethermind&editIndex=3&showCategory=Panel%20options&viewPanel=panel-25

So for example on which scenarios Nethermind is not the fastest and who is and by how much. 

Trying to nerd snipe <@316280621783580673> a bit to improve Neth more :D But maybe will be found useful for others :) For now only on GH triggered tests, soon will add it for other panels as well

author: bridge-bot
content:
<Arkenan> re: **@KamilChNethermind**
> @fede_intern 

Hi there! Saw your teams PR to gas-benchmarks - that is great!

I added it, not yet pushed onto machine but now during my other tests i triggered ethrex and see it fails pretty fast for EEST test suite with Invalid Sync status for newPayload:
https://github.com/NethermindEth/gas-benchmarks/actions/runs/16802148694/job/47585829416

I see it receives paylaods properly but does not do any processing?
Hi Kamil, thanks a bunch for including ethrex in the tests. We hadn't run the EEST test suite in this context, we'll fix this ASAP.

author: bridge-bot
content:
<siladu> Looks like perf-devnet-1 is spamming txs with empty bytes, is that expected?
```

2025-08-08 20:27:48.055+00:00 | vert.x-worker-thread-10 | ERROR | BaseJsonRpcProcessor | Error processing method: eth_sendRawTransaction ["0x"]
java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException: index is out of bounds```
